definitions.definition: cause (a liquid) to be ejected from a small opening in something in a thin, fast stream or jet.
examples: she squirted soda into a glass

definitions.definition: cause (a container of liquid) to eject its contents in a thin, fast stream.
examples: some youngsters squirted a water pistol in her face

definitions.definition: wet (someone or something) with a jet or stream of liquid in this way.
examples: she squirted me with the juice from her lemon wedge
synonyms: sprinkle; literarybesprinkle "she squirted me with cologne"

definitions.definition: (of a liquid) be ejected from something in this way.
examples: spurt, shoot, spray, fountain, jet, erupt; Moregush, rush, pump, surge, stream, spew, well, spring, burst, issue, emanate; emit, belch forth, expel, eject "a jet of ink squirted out of the tube"Moregush, rush, pump, surge, stream, spew, well, spring, burst, issue, emanate; emit, belch forth, expel, eject a jet of ink squirted out of the tube

definitions.definition: (of an object) move suddenly and unpredictably.
examples: he got his glove on the ball but it squirted away

definitions.definition: transmit (information) in highly compressed or speeded-up form.
a thin stream or small quantity of liquid ejected from something.
a small device from which a liquid may be ejected in a thin, fast stream.
a compressed radio signal transmitted at high speed.
a person perceived to be insignificant, impudent, or presumptuous.
examples: what did he see in this patronizing little squirt?
synonyms: picayune "he was just a little squirt"
